marketNews.title: RI Coal Exports to China Drop -12% YoY in 1H25
marketNews.content: China customs noted that coal imports from Indonesia in June 2025 plummeted -30% YoY to a level of approximately 11.6 million tons. This result brought China's coal imports from Indonesia during 1H25 to approximately 91 million tons, a decrease of -12% YoY. For context, Indonesia's coal exports to China still grew slightly during 1Q25 (+1% YoY), before starting to experience an annual decline in 4M25 (-5% YoY). The decline in China's imports of coal from Indonesia during 1H25 was deeper compared to imports from other countries, such as Russia (-4% YoY), Mongolia (-4% YoY), and Australia (-1% YoY). Generally, China's coal imports in June 2025 fell to approximately 33 million tons (-26% YoY, -8% MoM), marking the lowest monthly import since February 2023. This result caused China's total coal imports during 1H25 to drop -11% YoY to approximately 221.7 million tons. Reuters reported that the trend of declining coal imports from Indonesia to China occurs in line with increasing domestic coal production in China. Additionally, the decline in global coal prices has made high-quality coal—which produces more energy per ton—more cost-competitive, thus suppressing the demand for Indonesian coal supplies which have lower calorific value. Meanwhile, the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources noted that Indonesia's coal production since the beginning of 2025 reached approximately 390.2 million tons as of July 22, 2025, equivalent to approximately 53% of the 2025 target. Meanwhile, Indonesian coal exports reached approximately 199.2 million tons, only equivalent to approximately 40% of the 2025 target.

tickerNews.title: ASII Subsidiary Plans Acquisition of 83.67% MMLP Stake
tickerNews.content: Astra International (ASII) announced that its subsidiary, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya, has signed an agreement to acquire 83.67% of Mega Manunggal Property shares from PT Suwarna Arta Mandiri, Bridge Leed Limited, and several other minority shareholders. The transaction value has not been announced. After this transaction is completed, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya will become the new controller of MMLP and will execute a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Clarifies No Current Plan for PT Intam IPO
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company currently has no plans to hold an IPO for PT Intam, its business entity in the gold mining sector. CUAN's statement emerged after several national media reported that the company was preparing an IPO for PT Intam. In its clarification, CUAN explained that the company was never asked for any official information or confirmation by the media regarding the report.

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia Discusses Fleet Needs and Delivery Timing for Boeing Aircraft with Boeing
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company and Boeing are discussing the details of fleet needs appropriate for the company's market share, including aircraft delivery times. GIAA's statement followed recent reports that the company would purchase 50 Boeing aircraft, as part of trade negotiations with the US. GIAA said that the purchase plan is an effort to strengthen the fleet and optimize flight networks over the next 5 years. The company also explained that the funding source for the purchase of these aircraft will come from the company's financial restructuring plan.

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia to Recruit South Korean Company as New Strategic Partner for HPAL Project
tickerNews.content: The acting President Director of Vale Indonesia, Bernardus Irmanto, stated that a South Korean company will become the new strategic partner in the HPAL project in Sorowako, South Sulawesi. Although he did not detail the prospective partner, Bernardus mentioned that the South Korean company is currently completing land and licensing acquisition. Currently, INCO's partner in the HPAL project in Sorowako is Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt Co. from China.

tickerNews.title: Era Media Sejahtera Controller Increases Stake in DOOH
tickerNews.content: The controller of Era Media Sejahtera, PT Prambanan Investasi Sukses, purchased approximately 105.5 million shares of DOOH at an average price of 101 rupiah per share on July 17, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 10.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Prambanan Investasi Sukses's ownership in DOOH increased from 68.94% to 70.305%.

tickerNews.title: US Tariff of 19% on Indonesian Exports May Be Imposed Sooner Than August 1 Deadline
tickerNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Monday (7/21) that a 19% tariff on Indonesian export goods to the US could be imposed sooner than the August 1, 2025 deadline set by US President Donald Trump. Airlangga mentioned that the timing of the tariff implementation depends on a joint statement between the two countries, which is expected to be announced soon. Previously, Indonesia and the US reached a trade agreement last week, which caused import tariffs for goods originating from Indonesia to drop from 32% to 19%.

tickerNews.title: Task Force for Mineral Downstreaming Hands Over 18 Priority Downstreaming Projects to Danantara
tickerNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources and Head of the National Energy Downstreaming Acceleration and Resilience Task Force, Bahlil Lahadalia, on Tuesday (7/22) handed over pre-feasibility study documents for 18 priority downstreaming projects worth approximately 38.6 billion US dollars to Danantara. Bahlil explained that these 18 downstreaming projects are outside the scope of the electric vehicle battery ecosystem projects. The 18 downstreaming projects consist of 8 projects in the mineral and coal sector, 2 energy transition projects, 2 energy resilience projects, 3 agricultural downstreaming projects, and 3 marine and fishery downstreaming projects. The CEO of Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, stated that they will immediately follow up on the pre-feasibility study documents for these 18 downstreaming projects. Rosan claimed that these 18 projects will generate employment opportunities for more than 270 thousand people.

tickerNews.title: US Treasury Secretary Suggests Next US-China Talks Could Cover China's Russian and Iranian Oil Purchases
tickerNews.content: US Treasury Secretary, Scott Bessent, stated on Monday (7/21) that the next negotiations between the US and China could include discussions regarding China's purchases of Russian and Iranian oil. Bessent's statement came after US President Donald Trump threatened last week to impose a 'secondary tariff' of 100% on countries trading with Russia, if Russia does not reach a deal to end the war with Ukraine within the next 50 days. China is currently the main buyer of Russian and Iranian oil.

tickerNews.title: Oil Lifting Realization in 1H25 Reaches 578,000 Bopd, Gas Distribution Reaches 97.4% of Target
tickerNews.content: Head of SKK Migas, Djoko Siswanto, stated on Monday (7/21) that realized crude oil lifting during 1H25 reached 578,000 barrels per day, equivalent to 95.5% of the 2025 State Budget target of 605,000 barrels per day. Meanwhile, realized gas distribution reached 5,483 MMSCFD, equivalent to 97.4% of the 2025 State Budget target of 5,628 MMSCFD.

tickerNews.title: PT Jagat Raya Imajinasi Increases Stake in Bank Amar Indonesia (AMAR)
tickerNews.content: PT Jagat Raya Imajinasi bought approximately 1.2 billion shares of Bank Amar Indonesia (AMAR) at an average price of 119 rupiah per share on July 16, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 144 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Jagat Raya Imajinasi's ownership in AMAR increased from none to 6.58%.
